chunks.original_text: 龙吟虎啸，夫唱妇随。 玉鼎汤煎，金炉火炽。 雷轰电掣，撼动乾坤。 百脉耸然，三关透彻。 玄珠成象，太乙含真。 泥丸风生，绛宫月明，丹田烟暖，谷海波澄。 炼出还丹，易如反掌。 从此天关在手，地轴由心，更能昼运灵旗。 夜录神芝。 温就圣胎，结成赤子。 紫阳曰：‘都来片向功夫，永保无穷逸乐。 ’所谓道之基，德之本，龙虎之宗，铅汞之祖，一火所聚，八水同归，万神朝会之门，金丹妙用之源，乃归根复命之关窍也。 既能知此，则欲不必遣而心自静，心不澄而神自清。 一念不生，万幻俱寝，身驭扶摇，神游恢漠。 方知道风清月白，皆显扬铅汞之机，水绿山青，尽发露龙虎之旨。 ” 《海客论》曰：“夫汞者，积阴之气、玄水之精遇万机以成魂，事五金而作魄，重于金体，洁不许尘，悉在目前，有何难睹？ 紫阳曰：‘铅犹表也，汞犹影也。 汞是铅之兆魄精华也，各为其体，互藏其根。 五行相孕，金水相生。 得气转华，方成至药。 ’又曰：‘只是水银一味周流，遍历诸辰。 ’又曰：“水银一味是真物，先作肉兮后作骨。 ’成药只是一味水银，借神水之胎作紫金之粉。 古歌云：‘水银一味是仙药，从上流传伏火难。 若遇河车成紫粉，紫粉一时化金丹。 金丹正法本无钧，水银一味独为幽。 刀圭点化将为验，服之不死乏仙舟。 ’又云：‘却取抽成汞，还丹返作砂。 胎中受五彩，月足是黄芽。 迷途不可见，对面是天涯。 若到河车地，只此是仙家。 ’”
chunks.translated_text:
The Dragon roars, the Tiger howls—
husband and wife in perfect harmony.
The jade cauldron simmers with elixir,
the golden furnace blazes with fire.

Thunder crashes, lightning streaks—
shaking heaven and earth.
A hundred meridians surge,
the three passes pierce through.

The dark pearl takes form,
the Supreme Unity embraces the True.
The *dantian* wind stirs,
the Vermilion Palace glows with moonlight,
the cinnabar field warms with mist,
the *guhai* sea ripples clear.

Refining the Returning Elixir—
easy as turning one’s palm.
Henceforth, the Celestial Pass is in hand,
the Earthly Axis moves with the heart,
and one may wield the *lingqi* banner by day,
record divine herbs by night.

Warming the Sacred Embryo,
forming the Red Child.

Zhuangzi said:
*"All comes down to this single effort—
eternal boundless joy preserved."*

This is the foundation of the Dao,
the root of virtue,
the lineage of Dragon and Tiger,
the origin of lead and mercury.
One fire gathered,
eight waters converging—
the gate where ten thousand spirits assemble,
the source of the Golden Elixir’s marvels,
the pivotal moment of returning to the root and reclaiming life.

Once this is known,
desire need not be abandoned—
the mind stilled of its own accord,
the spirit clarified without effort.
No thought arises,
ten thousand illusions dissolve,
the body rides the *fuxiao* winds,
the spirit wanders the boundless void.

Only then does one understand:
the Dao’s breeze and moon’s purity—
all revealing the workings of lead and mercury,
the green waters and blue mountains—
fully disclosing the essence of Dragon and Tiger.

*The Sea Guest’s Treatise* says:
*"Mercury—
the accumulated *yin* qi, the essence of the dark waters,
encountering myriad transformations to form spirit,
serving the five metals to manifest soul.
Heavier than gold, purer than dust,
it lies before one’s eyes—
what difficulty is there in seeing it?"*

Zhuangzi said:
*"Lead is like a form,
mercury like its shadow.
Mercury is the vital essence, the refined soul of lead—
each possesses its own body,
mutually harboring its root.
The Five Phases interbreed,
metal and water generate one another.
When qi is obtained and transformations unfold,
only then does the supreme medicine form."*

Again he said:
*"It is but mercury, one substance,
flowing through all the celestial phases."*

And again:
*"Mercury is the true substance—
first flesh, then bone."*

The completed medicine is but mercury,
borrowing the womb of divine water
to become the powder of purple gold.

An ancient song says:
*"Mercury is the true elixir of immortals,
transmitted from above—
suppressed fire is hard to tame.
When the River Vehicle forms purple powder,
the purple powder instantly becomes the Golden Elixir.
The true method of the Golden Elixir has no equal—
mercury alone is profound.
The *daoji* blade verifies its transformation—
taken, it grants no death,
but the boat of immortality."*

And again:
*"Reverse-extracting yields mercury,
the Returning Elixir reverts to sand.
Within the womb, five colors are received,
a full moon brings the yellow sprout.
Lost paths cannot be seen—
face-to-face, it’s the edge of the world.
If you reach the River Vehicle’s domain,
this alone is the realm of the immortals."*

chunks.original_text: 《规中指南》曰：“修丹之士欲返其性、复其初，重生五脏，再立形骸，无质生质，结成圣胎，其诀曰：专气至柔，能如婴儿。 除姤止念，静心守一。 外想不入，内想不由。 终日混沌，如在母腹。 神定以会乎气，气和以合乎神。 神即炁而凝，炁即神而住。 于寂然休歇之场，恍兮若无何有之乡，天心冥冥，注意一窍，如鸡抱卵，似鱼在水，呼至于根，吸至于蒂，绵绵若存。 再守胎中之一息，守无所守，真息自住，泯然若无。 虽然，于心无所存注，杳冥之内，但觉太虚之中，一灵为造化之主宰。 ” 陆西星曰：“得一之后，混沌复为一太极，不必分南北西东之限，但当照顾关防，念头差动，慎其前功。 倘怀一时之兴浓，则忘却平日之辛苦，废大事矣。 ”

The *Gui Zhong Zhinan* states:

*"Those who cultivate the Elixir wish to restore their nature, return to their origin, regenerate the five viscera, and re-establish their form—
to give birth to substance from non-substance,
and form the sacred embryo.
Its secret lies here:
Concentrate the qi until it is supremely soft,
like an infant.
Eliminate distractions and still the mind,
quietly preserving the One.

External thoughts do not intrude,
internal thoughts do not arise.
The whole day is a state of primordial chaos,
as if still in the womb.
When the spirit aligns with the qi,
and the qi harmonizes with the spirit,
the spirit condenses into qi,
and the qi abides as spirit.

In the realm of still repose,
it seems as though in a land of nothingness—
the Heavenly Heart in profound darkness,
attending to a single orifice,
like a hen brooding her egg,
or a fish in water.
Exhale to the root,
inhale to the calyx,
endlessly sustained.

Then guard the single breath within the embryo,
guarding nothing—
the true breath abides of itself,
vanishing as if nonexistent.
Yet within the heart’s boundless void,
one consciousness becomes the sovereign of transformation."*

Lu Xixing remarked:
*"After attaining the One,
the chaos reintegrates as the Supreme Ultimate—
no need to distinguish east, west, south, or north,
only vigilance at the pass.
If the mind wanders,
beware lest all prior effort be lost.
Should one indulge a fleeting surge of passion,
they forget the toil of former days—
and thus ruin the great work."*

chunks.original_text: 上阳子曰：“一粒之丹，甚不易得。 费尽千辛万苦，方能得之。 既得之后，侥幸全此命宝。 更宜闲居幽处，温养珍调，损之又损，念欲灰而志欲奋，功欲勤而境欲忘。 其未用丹之时，行真个神仙之行。 若已得丹之后，怀全无所得之心。 则一切事物，不关心君而无危险，直至功成火足而不怠也。 ” 陶素耜曰：“尝抱冲和之真气，养静定之元神。 “温养之法，无过于淡泊。 淡泊者，致虚凝神，纯一不杂，顺其自然以守之而已。 “金液凝结之际，百脉归源，呼吸俱泯，日魂月魄，一时停轮，如命之将绝者。 绝而复生，紫清翁所谓‘这回大死今方活’，迨温养事毕，体化纯阳，方是丹成药就。 ” 白玉蟾曰：“若能于静定之中，抱冲和之气，守真一之精，即是封炉固济以行火候。 神即是火，炁即是药，以火炼药而成丹，即是以神御炁而成道。 ” 《仙佛合宗论语》曰：“十月炼定要人持叫，其时易昏沉外驰，散乱多而内定少，则用炼气化神法以补其神。 神满不思睡，神定不思驰，昏沉驰散渐少而渐定，以至于大定。 无炁与息，则息无出入，谓之息住。 ” 《仙佛合宗论语》曰：“十月之功，须要神炁精明，志念勇猛，昼夜勤功在定，定定相续，无一息一瞬而不在息定，自然得无息而大定。 大定之日，便是胎完之日。 神胎既就，毕竟景观而出．自然之理也。 ” 《仙佛合宗论语》：问定，答曰：“重阳祖云：‘呼吸相应，脉住气停。 静而生定，大定之中，先天一炁自虚无中而来。 ’又云：‘定中知动，方是造化。 ’邱祖云：‘息有一毫之不定，非命己有。 ’薛紫贤云：‘定息采真铅。 ’杏林曰：‘定里见丹成。 ’丹阳曰：‘功夫常不间，定息号灵胎。 ’太上曰：‘转神入定，以成至真。 ’《斗姥心经》云：‘知守本来真身，更能精修大定，乃至形神俱妙。 ’元始天尊云：‘息依神定，性定命住。 ’紫阳云：‘惟定可以炼丹，不定而阳不生。 阳生之后，不定而丹不结。 ’《中和集》云：‘九载三年常一定，便是神仙。 ’” 《仙佛合宗论语》曰：“能调此真息，即能定此真性。 息不定，即心性不定。 人能即此息，而离此息，斯可人灭尽定矣。 ” 谭子《化书》云：“心冥冥兮无所知，神怡怡兮无所之，气熙熙兮无所为。 ” 《中和集》曰：“丹从不炼炼中炼，道向无为为处无。 息念息缘调祖炁，忘闻忘见养婴儿。 “静里功夫，定中斡运。 寂然不动，应感而通。 老蚌含珠，螟蛉咒子。 个样真机妙莫穷，只这是，若疑团打破，顿悟真空。 “为中会取无为个，不有中间有最奇。 到恍惚之间，窈冥之际，守之即妄，纵又成非，不守不忘，不收不纵，看这存存在底谁？ 只恁么，待六阳数足，抱小蟾儿。 ” 《脉望》曰：“丹既居鼎，真火周遭于外，以为表卫，始终以无念为常，盖心静则气和，气和则神清，无念日久，太和神气充溢于金胎神室之中，子母相抱，非神火环匝之力，岂能留之哉？ 必须臾不离，夜以继日，自然丹熟脱胎矣。 ” 上阳子曰：“精少则还丹不成，大修行人，当知己汞常要充满，是云‘实腹’。 己汞既充，取铅稍易，又当知采药之时，六识不具，六情俱忘，是云‘虚心’。 ” 《规中指南》曰：“用志不分，乃凝于神。
chunks.translated_text:
The Master of Upper Yang said:
*"A single grain of elixir—
how difficult to obtain!
Exhausting every hardship and toil,
only then can it be acquired.
Once obtained, it is a fortunate preservation of this precious life.
Then one should reside in seclusion, nurturing and refining it with care—
reducing it again and again,
desiring the mind to fade while the will must rise,
laboring with fervor while the realm is forgotten.
Before the elixir is used,
one walks the true Daoist path.
If one has already obtained the elixir,
they hold the heart of complete emptiness—
then all affairs and things
do not concern them, and there is no peril,
until the work is complete, the fire is full, yet they remain undeterred."*

Tao Suzi said:
*"I have often embraced the true *qi* of harmony,
nurturing the settled essence of the Primordial Spirit.
The method of nurturing lies in nothing more than simplicity and detachment.
Simplicity and detachment mean
attaining emptiness and focusing the spirit,
pure and unadulterated,
following nature’s course to preserve it.

At the moment when the golden essence congeals,
all meridians return to their source,
breathing ceases,
and the daily spirit and monthly spirit
halt their wheels as if life were about to end.
Ending and then reborn,
the Master of Purple Clarity speaks of *'This death is now true life.'*
When the nurturing is complete,
the body transforms into Pure Yang—
then the elixir is formed, the medicine is ready."*

White Jade Shaan said:
*"If one can, within the settled stillness,
embrace the harmonious *qi*,
guard the true essence of the One,
then they seal the furnace and secure the crossing to proceed with the fire’s stages.
The spirit is the fire,
the *qi* is the medicine—
refining the medicine with fire to form the elixir
is the same as mastering the *qi* with the spirit to attain the Dao."*

*The Daoist-Buddhist Concordance on the Analects* says:
*"During the ten months of refining, one must hold the call.
At this time, drowsiness and distraction are easy,
scattered thoughts prevail while inner stillness is scarce—
then the method of refining *qi* to transform the spirit is used to supplement the spirit.
When the spirit is full, one does not think of sleep;
when the spirit is settled, one does not think of wandering.
Drowsiness and distraction gradually diminish,
stillness grows until the Great Stillness arrives.
Without *qi* and breath,
breath has no coming or going—
this is called *xi zhu* [息住]."*

*The Daoist-Buddhist Concordance on the Analects* says:
*"The ten months’ work requires
the spirit and *qi* to be clear and bright,
the will and mind to be bold and fierce.
Day and night, one must diligently labor within stillness,
stillness continuing without pause,
not a single breath or instant without being in breath-stillness—
then naturally one attains the Great Stillness without breath.
On the day of Great Stillness,
it is the day of the embryo’s completion.
The spirit-embryo having formed,
it finally manifests and emerges—
this is the natural order."*

*The Daoist-Buddhist Concordance on the Analects*:
Q: *"What is stillness?"*
A: *"The Master of Double Yang said:
*'Breath and stillness correspond,
pulse ceases, *qi* stops.
Stillness generates stillness—
within Great Stillness, the Primordial *qi* of the First Heaven arises from emptiness.'*
He also said:
*'Within stillness, knowing movement—
this is transformation.'*
Qiu Zu said:
*'If the breath has even a hair’s breadth of unsettledness,
it is not one’s own life to possess.'*
Xue Zixian said:
*'Stillness and breath refine True Lead.'*
Xinglin said:
*'Within stillness, the elixir is seen to form.'*
Danyang said:
*'The practice must never cease—
stillness and breath are the sacred embryo.'*
The Most High said:
*'Turning the spirit into stillness,
one attains the Supreme True.'*
*The Scripture of the Martial Granny’s Heart* says:
*'Knowing to guard the original true body,
one can further refine the Great Stillness,
until form and spirit are both perfected.'*
The Celestial Sovereign of Yuan Shi says:
*'Breath depends on stillness,
nature settled, life preserved.'*
Ziyang says:
*'Only stillness can refine the elixir—
without stillness, Yang does not arise.
After Yang arises,
without stillness, the elixir does not congeal.'*
*The Collection of Central Harmony* says:
*'Nine years and three months of constant stillness—
this is the Daoist path.'*

*The Daoist-Buddhist Concordance on the Analects* says:
*"One who can regulate this true breath
can settle this true nature.
If the breath is unsettled,
then the heart-nature is unsettled.
If a person can attain this breath
and depart from this breath,
then they may enter the stage of Complete Extinction."*

Tan Zi’s *Book of Transformation* says:
*"The heart is dim and knows nothing,
the spirit is tranquil and wanders nowhere,
the *qi* is serene and does nothing."*

*The Collection of Central Harmony* says:
*"The elixir is refined within the unrefined,
the Dao lies in the realm of non-action.
Regulate the ancestral *qi* by stilling breath and roots—
nurture the infant by forgetting sound and sight.
The practice lies within stillness,
the skill within settledness.
Motionless and silent,
yet responsive to all sensations.
The aged conch holds its pearl,
the silkworm guards its cocoon.
Such is the true mystery beyond measure—
only this: if doubts are shattered,
one suddenly awakens to the True Void.

Within action, one meets the non-action—
the most wondrous paradox lies in the midst of nothingness.
At the moment of vague realization,
within the depths of boundless mystery,
to guard is to delude,
to release is to err.
Neither guarding nor forgetting,
neither restraining nor releasing—
who then holds this existence?
Just so—
await the six Yang phases to be complete,
and embrace the little toad."*

*The Pulse Observations* say:
*"Once the elixir resides in the cauldron,
true fire surrounds it externally,
acting as its protective shield,
constantly maintaining a state of non-thought.
For when the heart is still, the *qi* is harmonious;
when the *qi* is harmonious, the spirit is clear.
Without thought, day after day,
the Great Harmony and the spirit’s *qi* overflow into the golden elixir’s sacred chamber—
parent and child embrace,
and without the encircling power of the spirit-fire,
how could it be retained?
It must not be abandoned for an instant,
night and day without pause—
then naturally the elixir ripens, and the embryo is cast off."*

The Master of Upper Yang said:
*"If the essence is scant, the Returned Elixir will not form.
Great practitioners must know
that their own mercury must always be full—
this is called *'solid abdomen.'*
Once their own mercury is full,
taking the lead is slightly easier—
they must also know
that when gathering the medicine,
the six senses are not present,

one perceives the inner landscape—
when the mind’s intent arrives,
the signs begin to stir.

one must forget the *qi* and merge with the spirit,
returning to the ultimate unity of *Hún-Dùn* [混沌],

I now focus my primordial spirit, congealing and nurturing it within—

the ten-month embryo complete,

the source of all transformation and generation.

Xiao Zixu said:

not stirring a hair until the Jade Pass is reached—

as yin and yang qi circulates on its own."*

*The Heavenly Immortal’s True Principles* say:
*"After this, the fire stage is called the Great Microcosmic Orbit,
distinct from the prior hundred-day Small Microcosmic Orbit.
Master Lü said:
*'From now on, only blow the windless flute,
from today, strike the stringless zither.'*"

*The Heavenly Immortal’s True Principles* say:
*"The Great Microcosmic Orbit—
like the sun completing one full revolution.
One cycle thus, ten, hundred, thousand, myriad cycles follow.
One moment thus, three thousand six hundred moments likewise—
all to complete the ten-month celestial orbit.
Conception, refining qi and transforming spirit into stillness—
this is the sign of one who has entered.
Within this, some attain stillness in three months,
and thus abstain from worldly flavors.
Some in four or five months, or even longer,
before they cease eating.
The faster one abstains, the sooner stillness is attained.
The slower the abstention, the longer the delay in entering stillness.
For when stillness is achieved, the Original Harmony’s vital qi fills the body—
then hunger is unseen, why eat?
Food is yin; one measure of yin requires one measure of food.
So long as yin remains, one does not transcend.
So long as food is consumed, transcendence is unattained."*

*The Heavenly Immortal’s True Principles* say:
*"A steadfast heart brings easy stillness.
Some attain it in seven months,
some in eight, nine, or ten.
If the heart is scattered, stillness is hard—
some take months beyond ten, even countless,
before achieving it—
this is the result of lingering breath and cold fire,
delaying the Elixir’s power.
Now speaking of those who attain Great Stillness in ten months:
Within this, as the spirit-embryo nears completion,
in the eighth, ninth, or tenth month,
external phenomena abound—
some see wonders, some hear marvels,
some encounter joyous or fearful things,
some trustworthy or deceptive matters,
some arise from delusion,
some are tested by celestial immortals,
or demons come to steal vital qi—
all must be swept away with right mindfulness,
refining qi and transforming spirit with pure intent,
until even breathing ceases and demons retreat."*

*The Heavenly Immortal’s True Principles* say:
*"If a stray thought arises within,
quickly summon right mindfulness—
the stray thought vanishes.
If a demon appears before the eyes,
quickly summon right mindfulness—
do not engage, and the demon retreats.
The *Forty-Nine Chapter Scripture* says:
*'Do not contend with the hemp demon—
those who come will return on their own.'*
Ge Ding Lingyang said:
*'In stillness, deepening the practice,
one may see sages, Buddhas, ghosts, spirits,
palaces, radiance—
do not let the heart cling or reject.'*
Yu Yuwu said:
*'Let a thousand transformations unfold—
the mind unmoved, all evils retreat.'*"

*The Heavenly Immortal’s True Principles* say:
*"Once breathing is truly absent,
qi returns to pure spirit—
no longer is there qi or breath.
If breath remains, though seemingly without leakage,
it is not true cessation.
If breathing is only partially still,
the spirit follows—
only partially still, not fully.
Now is the time for meticulous practice,
entering Great Stillness and pure spirit.
If there is any interruption or separation,
it is like fleeing the Elixir—
one must reach the point of no qi before completion.
This is the second gate’s principle of Returning to One,
restoring the state of primordial union before birth.
A child’s ten months—form complete, life begins.
A spirit-embryo’s ten months—spirit complete, transcendence is achieved.
This is the natural order.
Master Qiu said:
*'If breath is ever unstable by a hair,
life is not yet secured.'*"

*The Heavenly Immortal’s True Principles* say:
*"The Great Microcosmic Orbit’s fire is beyond divination—
not forced, yet not idle,
warmly continuous,
neither clinging to presence nor absence,
initially seeming neither here nor there,
ultimately returning to Great Stillness."*

*The Great Communion Scripture* says:
*"The Dao has no form—
thus within, it is not confined by existence.
True nature is without action—
thus without, the heart is not lost."*

*The Supreme Lord’s Daily Scripture* says:
*"Spirit is the child of qi,
qi is the mother of spirit—
like a hen brooding an egg,
nurturing spirit and preserving qi,
how could they ever separate?
Wonderful! Wonderful!"*

chunks.original_text: 定息内观，一意不散，神识俱妙。 静中常闻乐声，如梦非梦，若在虚无之中，风光景物，不比尘俗。 繁华美丽，胜于人世。 楼台宫阙，碧瓦凝辉。 翡翠绮罗，馨香成阵。 当此之时，乃日超内院，阳神方得聚会而还上丹田，炼成神仙，以合大道，一撞大门，金光影里现法身，闹花深处坐凡体，乘空而愎平川，万里若同展臂。 ” 《传道集》曰：“云雷下降，烟焰上起，或如天雨奇花，祥风瑞气，自殿庭而起。 或如仙娥玉女，彩凤祥鸾，自青霄而来，金盘中捧玉露霞浆，而下献于王者。 若此乃金液还丹，既济之象也。 龙虎曳车于火中，上冲三关，三关各有兵吏，不计几何。 器仗戈甲，恐惧于人。 先以龙虎撞之不开，次以大火烧之方启，以至昆仓不住，又到天池方止。 或如三鹤冲天，或如双蝶入三宫，或五彩云中，捧朱衣小儿而过天门，或金车玉辂载王者而超三界，若此乃肘后飞金精、大河车之象也。 一吏传命，而九洲通和，周而复始，运行不已，或如游五岳，或如泛五湖，或如天符敕五帝，或如王命诏诸侯，若此乃还丹之象也。 ” 《传道集》曰：“自上而下，紫河车搬入天宫，天宫富贵，孰不饮羡？ 或往或来，繁华奢侈，人所未见者，悉皆有之。 奉道之士，平日清净自守，潇洒，寂寞，既已久矣。 功至数足，快乐无极。 楼台珠翠，女乐笙簧，珍馐异馔，异草奇花，景物风光，触目如画。 彼人不悟，将谓实到天宫，不知自身内院，认作真境，因循不出，乃日因在昏衢，留形住世，不得脱质以为神仙。 未到天宫，方在内观，阴鬼外魔，因意生境，以为魔军，因而狂荡入于邪中，或失身外道，以至不能成仙，盖以三尸七魄，惟愿人死，而自身快乐。 九虫六贼，苦于人安，则存留无处也。 ”

「When the breath is settled and inner observation attained,
with a single mind undivided,
both spirit and insight become wondrous.
In stillness, one often hears melodious sounds,
like a dream yet not a dream,
as if amid boundless void,
where winds and landscapes surpass the mundane dust.
Opulence and splendor outshine the human world—
palaces and gates, jade tiles gleaming with frost.
Feathers of jade and brocade, fragrant as clouds of incense,
when this moment arrives,
one ascends the Inner Court,
the yang spirit gathers and returns to the Upper Elixir Field,
refining into an immortal,
to merge with the Great Dao.
A single strike at the Great Gate—
golden light reveals the Dharma Body within the shadowy glow,
amidst flowers in bloom, the mundane form sits still.
Riding the void, one soars across flat plains,
ten thousand miles like stretching one’s arms.»

*The Transmission of the Dao Collection* says:
*"When clouds and thunder descend,
and smoke and flames ascend,
it may be as if the heavens rain strange blossoms,
auspicious winds and celestial qi arise from the palace courtyard.
Or like celestial maidens and jade-feathered cranes,
rainbow-winged phoenixes descending from the Azure Sky,
bearing golden platters of luminous dew and River Vehicle essence,
to present before the Sage.
This is the symbol of the Golden Elixir Returning to the Elixir Field—
the *Ji* (achievement) phase.
The Dragon and Tiger drag the River Vehicle through fire,
surging past the Three Passes,
each pass guarded by countless officials,
their numbers beyond reckoning.
Their armor and weapons strike fear in mortals—
first, the Dragon and Tiger clash yet fail to open it,
then great fire burns until the gate at last unfolds,
until the Kun Chamber cannot contain them,
and they reach the Heavenly Pool before ceasing.
Or like three cranes surging toward the sky,
or twin butterflies entering the Three Palaces,
or five-colored clouds bearing a child in scarlet robes,
passing through the Heavenly Gate,
or golden chariots and jade litters conveying the Sage,
soaring past the Three Realms—
these are the symbols of the *Arm’s Gold Ascending* and the Great River Vehicle.
When one official delivers the decree,
the Nine Continents harmonize in unison,
cycling endlessly, their operations ceasing not—
like wandering the Five Sacred Mountains,
or drifting across the Five Lakes,
or the Celestial Edict commanding the Five Emperors,
or the Sovereign’s mandate summoning the feudal lords—
these are the symbols of the Returning to the Elixir Field.*

*The Transmission of the Dao Collection* says:
*"From above descending below,
the Purple River Vehicle transports essence into the Heavenly Palace,
where wealth and honor abound—
who would not envy?
Coming and going in splendor,
luxury beyond mortal sight,
all present.
Those who follow the Dao
keep themselves pure and serene in daily life,
unbound, solitary, and long withdrawn from the world.
When their practice reaches fulfillment,
their joy knows no limit—
palaces of pearls and jade,
music and dance of celestial maidens,
rare delicacies and exotic feasts,
strange grasses and marvelous flowers,
scenery and breezes like painted visions.
If others do not awaken,
they may think it real—
that one has truly arrived at the Heavenly Palace,
not realizing the Inner Court’s own domain,
mistaking illusion for reality,
and clinging without escape.
Thus, they linger in the dim crossroads,
retain their form in this world,
and fail to transcend their substance to become immortals.

Before reaching the Heavenly Palace,
one remains in inner observation—
outer demons and inner ghosts,
stirred by intent, create false realms,
as if an army of fiends.
Driven mad, they plunge into error,
or lose themselves to heterodox paths,
even failing to become immortals.
For the Three Corpses and Seven Orifices
desire only the death of others,
while their own joy remains unfulfilled.
The Nine Vermin and Six Thieves
torment those who dwell in peace,
leaving no refuge for those who would escape.
Thus, they remain trapped in the world’s illusions,
unable to ascend."*

chunks.original_text: 朱元育曰：“一阳初动，急发火以应之，必须猛烹急炼，加以吸，舐，撮，闲之功，逼出炉火中金液，今之上开，趁此火力，驾动河车，自尾闾逆流，上昆仑天谷穴，如龙争虎斗，凤涛汹涌，撼动乾坤。 交媾之后，一点落于黄庭中央。 此后便加温养之功，如龙护珠，如鸡抱卵，默默回光，勿忘勿助。 到得玄珠成象，太乙含真，自然变化而超脱矣。 ” 朱元育曰：“金丹结胎，脉住气停，复返混沌。 此吾身大死之时也。 久之，绝后再醒，亲证本来面目，自然纯清绝点，慧性圆通，大地乾坤，惧作水晶宫阙矣。 ” 朱元育曰：“有神丹局，当以真意守之，密密提防护持，须臾不可离。 若真意一离本位，恐有昏迷走失之患。 ” 朱元育曰：“先天祖炁为君，后天精气为臣，鼎中既得先天一炁，却借后天精气乳哺而环卫之。 ” 缘督子曰：“形神无为，而精炁自然有所为，是犹天地无为，而万物自然化育也。 ” 吕祖《金玉经》曰：“骊龙抱一，金珠现无上之光。 白虎含三，紫雪长灵苗之蕊。 ” 《金玉经》曰：“九重铁鼓无私，一片金铃向上。 透天堂，贯紫府甑山。 上至祝融峰，瑶池畔岸，三摩地。 一气贯黄中，铅珠归宝藏。 ” 《唱道真言》曰：“常惺惺存活泼泼地。 ” 《唱道真言》曰：“欲结圣胎，先登圆觉，此要语也，调剂之功，全在升降。 升降之诀，全在静观。 静不终静，静中有动，有动非动，造化旋转。 观不执观，观中有觉。 有觉非觉，灵光恍惚。 当此之时，鼎虚而药实，水刚而火柔。 一烹一炼，一呼一吸，旨与天地同其玄化，日月同其运转，阴阳同其清浊，四时同其代谢。 ” 《唱道真言》曰：“夫炼丹犹如饮饭，出急则焦，火缓则烂。 不急不缓，饭乃味全。 炼丹火急，则铅走汞飞，故贵绵绵若存。 火缓则鼎寒炉冷，固贵惺惺常在。 不急不缓，火候到时，群阴自消，阳神自现。 ” 《唱道真言》曰：“胸怀浩荡，妙至忘身，无我无人，何天何地？ 觉清空一气，混混沌沌中一点真阳，是我非我，是虚非虚。 造化旋转，错行代明，分之无可分，合之无可合。 以阳神之虚，合太虚之虚，而融洽无间，所谓形神俱妙，与道合真也。 ” 《唱道真言》曰：“绵绵若存，用之不勤。 惺惺常在，守之不败。 ” 《唱道真言》曰：“始之以无为，终之以无思，则天清宁于上，地安其位于下，然后阴阳混合以成珠，收罗于玄玄一窍之中。 颠之，倒之，恍焉惚焉，一炉造化，万斛神光。 ” 《唱道真言》曰：“黍米之珠，万物备而四气周，八风平而三才具。 ” 《唱道真言》曰：“金精木液，战斗一翻，鼓九阆之璈，而弹八风之瑟，日月出于脐下，风云起于腋间，圆陀陀，赤洒洒，仍是一个清虚洞玄，鸿蒙一气之太极也。 此中有天地焉，有日月焉，飞潜动植，胎卵湿化，无一物不备。 灵机一到，万籁齐鸣，一元显象，不可言尽。 ” 《唱道真言》曰：“斗罡从此而旋转，阴阳因之而颠倒。 功满道成，纯阳至刚之气，熏肌炼骨，法体温和，四季皆吞。 太阳在顶上，有昼无夜。 造化在身中，有生无杀。 ”
chunks.translated_text:
Zhu Yuanyou said:
*"When the first movement of Yang stirs,
urgently kindle fire to respond—
it must be a fierce boiling and rapid refining,
with the functions of inhalation, licking, and gathering,
forcing the golden elixir from the furnace flames.
Now that the upper opening is achieved,
seize this fiery force,
drive the River Chariot in reverse,
from the tail end against the current,
ascending to Kunlun’s Heavenly Valley Cavity—
like dragons battling tigers,
phoenix waves surging,
shaking heaven and earth.
After copulation,
a single point descends to the Yellow Court’s center.
From then on, apply the function of nurturing warmth—
like a dragon guarding a pearl,
like a hen brooding an egg,
silently returning the light,
neither forgetting nor aiding.
When the Mysterious Pearl takes form,
Taiyi contains the True Essence,
and naturally transforms to transcend."*

Zhu Yuanyou said:
*"When the Golden Elixir forms the embryo,
the pulse halts and the breath stops,
returning to the chaos of the undifferentiated.
This is the time of my body’s great death.
After long oblivion, rebirth awakens—
one attains the original face,
naturally pure and spotless,
with enlightened nature fully awakened,
the vast earth and sky
transformed into a crystal palace."*

Zhu Yuanyou said:
*"When the Divine Elixir Furnace is established,
guard it with true intent,
protecting it vigilantly—
not a moment may it depart.
If true intent strays from its place,
there may be the danger of confusion and loss."*

Zhu Yuanyou said:
*"The primordial ancestral *qi* is the sovereign,
the post-heavenal essence-*qi* the minister.
Once the furnace obtains the primordial *qi*,
it borrows the post-heavenal essence-*qi*
to nourish and encircle it."*

Yuanzi of the Governing Vessel said:
*"Form and spirit act without effort,
yet essence and *qi* naturally act of their own accord—
just as Heaven and Earth act without effort,
yet all things naturally transform and nurture."*

Master Lü’s *Golden Jade Scripture* says:
*"The dark dragon embraces the One,
the golden pearl radiates supreme light.
The white tiger contains the Three,
the purple snow nurtures the immortal’s bud."*

The *Golden Jade Scripture* says:
*"Nine layers of iron drums sound impartially,
a single golden bell rings upward.
Piercing the Heavenly Hall,
penetrating the Purple Bureau’s Furnace Mountain,
ascending to the Zhurong Peak,
the banks of the Jade Pool—
the *Samādhi* of Threefold Concentration.
A single breath pierces the Yellow Center,
the lead-pearl returns to the treasure vault."*

The *Chant of the True Words* says:
*"Always remain alert and lively."*

The *Chant of the True Words* says:
*"To form the sacred embryo,
first ascend to Perfect Awareness—
this is the essential instruction.
The art of regulation lies in ascent and descent.
The secret of ascent and descent lies in still observation.
Stillness is not absolute stillness—
within stillness, there is movement.
Movement is not true movement—
creation turns in cycles.
Observation is not fixed observation—
within observation, there is awareness.
Awareness is not true awareness—
the numinous light flickers indistinctly.
At this moment,
the furnace is empty yet the elixir is real,
water is firm while fire is yielding.
Each boiling, each refining,
each inhalation, each exhalation—
its essence aligns with Heaven and Earth’s mysterious transformation,
with the sun and moon’s revolutions,
with yin and yang’s purity and turbidity,
with the four seasons’ succession."*

The *Chant of the True Words* says:
*"Refining the elixir is like eating—
too hasty, it burns;
too slow, it rots.
Neither too hasty nor too slow,
then the flavor is complete.
If the elixir’s fire is too fierce,
lead flees and mercury scatters—
thus, it must be gentle, as if barely present.
If the fire is too slow,
the furnace grows cold—
thus, it must be ever-alert.
Neither too fierce nor too slow,
when the moment arrives,
all yin dissipates,
the yang spirit manifests."*

The *Chant of the True Words* says:
*"With a boundless heart,
reaching the sublime where the self is forgotten,
no self, no other—
what heaven, what earth?
Awakening to the empty *qi*,
within the indistinct chaos,
a single point of true yang—
it is me, yet not me;
it is void, yet not void.
Creation turns in cycles,
light and darkness alternate—
divided, it cannot be divided;
united, it cannot be united.
With the yang spirit’s void,
uniting with the Great Void’s void,
they blend seamlessly—
this is the perfection of form and spirit,
uniting with the Dao’s truth."*

The *Chant of the True Words* says:
*"Gentle, as if barely present—
use it without overdoing.
Ever-alert—
guard it without failure."*

The *Chant of the True Words* says:
*"Begin with non-action,
end with non-thought,
then Heaven clears above in serenity,
Earth steadies below in its place,
and only then do yin and yang blend to form the pearl,
collected within the deepest of orifices.
Tumbled, inverted,
dimly luminous—
a single furnace’s creation,
ten thousand measures of divine light."*

The *Chant of the True Words* says:
*"The millet-pearl contains all things,
the four seasons complete,
the eight winds stilled,
the Three Powers fulfilled."*

The *Chant of the True Words* says:
*"Gold’s essence and wood’s fluid clash in battle,
striking the nine-layered *tianluo* bell,
plucking the eight-wind lute—
the sun and moon emerge from the navel,
winds and clouds rise from the armpits,
round and radiant,
yet still a single Clear Void Cavern,
the primordial *hun*’s *qi*—the Supreme Ultimate.
Within it are heaven and earth,
are sun and moon.
Flying, creeping, moving, planting,
egg-born, wet-nurtured—
not a single thing is lacking.
When the numinous spark arrives,
all sounds resound together,
the One Principle manifests—
inexpressible."*

The *Chant of the True Words* says:
*"The *dou* and *gang* stars begin their revolution,
yin and yang invert as a result.
When the work is complete and the Dao achieved,
pure yang’s most potent *qi*
permeates the flesh and refines the bones,
the body’s law is gentle and harmonious,
swallowing all four seasons.
The Great Sun rests atop the head,
with no night.
Creation dwells within the body,
with no killing."*

chunks.original_text: 《唱道真言》曰：“周身之气，循环升降，上应周天，如十五夜潮，汹涌而来，穿筋涤髓，骨节粉碎。 要在临事从容，当境不乱，任他风浪漫江，由我舟随舵转。 ” 张三丰《金丹节要》曰：“三花聚顶，五气朝元，所谓阴消阳长，矿尽金纯，遍体纯阳，脱胎换骨，更生五脏，再立百骸。 肝脏换时，满目金光，睛如虎漆。 心胜换时，口生灵液，血化白骨。 脾脏换时，肌若凝脂，面如傅粉。 肺脏换时，鼻闻天香，颜复童儿。 肾脏换时，耳闻天乐之音，发断斑白之色。 有斯功验，自然出神。 ”

The *"Chant of the True Words"* says:
*"The qi of the whole body circulates and ascends in cycles,
resonating with the **Great Heavenly Circuit**,
like the flood tide of the fifteenth night—
rising tumultuous and fierce,
penetrating the sinews and purging the marrow,
shattering the bones and joints.
Essential is calmness in action,
clarity in circumstance—
let others unleash winds and waves upon the river,
while my vessel follows the rudder’s turn."*

Zhang Sanfeng’s *"Essentials of the Golden Elixir"* states:

the Five Qi bow toward the Primordial.
This is where yin is consumed and yang grows long,

The whole body is suffused with pure yang—

the five viscera regenerated,

When the liver is transformed,

When the heart is transformed,
its wisdom flows from the mouth—
blood crystallizes into white bones.
When the spleen is transformed,
the flesh solidifies like congealed fat,
the face blooms with powdered radiance.
When the lungs are transformed,
the nostrils scent celestial fragrance,
the complexion returns to that of a child.
When the kidneys are transformed,
the ears hear the music of the heavens,
the hair turns ashen-white with sudden clarity.
With such efficacy achieved,
the spirit naturally departs."*

chunks.original_text: 张三丰《无根树》曰：“匠手高强牢把舵，一任洪波海底翻。 过三关，透泥丸，早把通身九窍穿。 ” 曹文逸仙姑曰：“元和内运即成真，呼吸外求终未了。 ” 《金丹节要》曰：“调踵息而绵绵，合入合出，心而默然，内静外澄，似有如无，神凝气结。 ” 陈希夷曰：“倏尔火轮煎地脉，□然神□出山巅。 ” 邱长春曰：“金丹冲上斡天罡，何患阻桥又阻关？ 一意不生神不动，六根不动引循环。 ” 《仙佛合宗语录》曰：“既采得金丹大药，逆运河车，入于神室之中矣，倘其神光失照，则大药失其配偶而旋顷，故必以元神为大药之归依，以大药为元神之点化，相与寂照不离。 ” 《仙佛合宗语录》曰：“服食大药之后，三关九窍阻塞之处尽已开通。 须知此后二炁勤生，自然运动于已通之路。 ” 《仙佛合宗语录》曰：“问十月关中，历身景验。 冲虚子曰：‘初入定时，守定三月，则二炁之动机甚微，但微动于脐轮之虚境而已。 若守至四、五月间，则二气因神之寂照，以至食脉已尽，而皆归定机，元神因二炁培育，以至阳明不昧而得证真空。 二气俱停，食脉已绝，独有一寂照之元神以为胎仙之主。 更守至六、七月间，不但心不生灭，亦且昏睡全无，更守至八、九月，则寂照已久，百脉俱住。 更守至十月，则侯足阳纯，神归大定，于是定能生慧，自有天眼通，天耳通，宿命通，他心通，神境通也。 前炼精时，已有漏尽通，至此方有后五通之验也。 天眼通则能见天上之事，天耳通则能闻天上之言，宿命通则能晓前世之因，他心通则能知未来之事。 惟神境一通、乃识神用事，若不能保扶心君，即为识神移转，却自喜其能修能证，而欢喜魔已入于心矣。 由是喜言人间之祸福，喜言未来之事机，祸不旋踵而至矣。 惟是慧而不用，转识成智，始能证胎圆之果。 古云，三万刻中无间断，行行坐坐转分明正，乃发明十月养胎只在绵密寂照之功而已全矣。 ’” 《仙佛合宗语录》曰：“但有一毫昏沉之意，余阴尚在。 有一境淆乱之念，神未纯阳。 必须守到昏沉尽绝，淆乱全无，方为纯阳果满之胎神。 《樵阳经》曰：‘三百日火，十个月胎。 ’到此内境朗然，此时百魔俱出，引入他宗。 必寻常时积功累行，而天神自佑。 结丹之后，有许多景象，皆是平生夙习杂念。 至此尽出。 ”
chunks.translated_text:
Zhang Sanfeng in *The Rootless Tree* says:
*"The artisan’s skill is masterful, gripping the helm firm—
let the surging tides churn at the ocean’s depths.
Pass the Three Passes, pierce the Muddy Pill,
and soon the nine orifices of the body are all pierced through."*

Cao Wenyixian, the Immortal Maiden, says:
*"The Original Unity’s internal cultivation alone is true—
seeking breath externally is never complete."*

*The Golden Elixir Key Points* says:
*"Adjust the stepping-breath to be continuous and unbroken,
inhaling and exhaling in harmony—
the mind remains silent, inwardly still and outwardly clear,
as if present yet absent, the spirit condensed, the qi solidified."*

Chen Xiyi says:
*"Sudden—fire wheels seethe the earth’s meridians,
and the spirit bursts forth from the mountain’s peak."*

Qiu Changchun says:
*"The Golden Elixir surges upward, overturning the Heavenly Gang,
what fear of blocked bridges or barricaded passes?
With single-minded resolve, the spirit stirs not—
the six senses unmoved, guiding the circulation."*

*The Records of Daoist-Buddhist Fusion* says:
*"Once the Great Elixir elixir is obtained and the River Chariot is reversed,
entering the Godly Chamber,
if the divine light fails to illuminate,
the elixir loses its counterpart and dissipates swiftly.
Thus, the Original Spirit must serve as the elixir’s refuge,
and the elixir must refine the Original Spirit—
the two abide in inseparable stillness and luminosity."*

*The Records of Daoist-Buddhist Fusion* says:
*"After ingesting the Great Elixir,
the blockages at the Three Passes and Nine Orifices are all cleared.
Know that thereafter, the two *qi* will spontaneously generate,
naturally moving through the now-open pathways."*

*The Records of Daoist-Buddhist Fusion* says:
*"On the Ten-Month Pass and its bodily verifications,
Master Chongxu said:
‘When first entering *dhyāna*, if one steadfastly abides for three months,
the movement of the two *qi* is extremely subtle,
merely stirring at the navel’s void.
If one perseveres to four or five months,
the two *qi*, under the spirit’s stillness and luminosity,
cease their nourishing currents entirely,
all converging at the *dhyāna*-point.
The Original Spirit, nurtured by the two *qi*,
attains unobstructed Yang-Ming and realizes True Emptiness.
The two *qi* cease, the nourishing currents are cut—
only the still-luminous Original Spirit remains as the master of the fetal immortal.

If one guards further to six or seven months,
not only does the mind cease arising and passing,
but even slumber vanishes entirely.
If one guards to eight or nine months,
prolonged stillness and luminosity ensue,
and all meridians still.
If one guards to ten months,
the feet’s yang is pure, the spirit returns to Great Stillness—
thus, stillness generates wisdom,
and naturally arise the *divine eye*, *divine ear*,
*past-life recollection*, *mind-reading*,
and *spirit-realm penetration*.
Earlier, during the refining of essence,
there was already the *leakage-free penetration*;
now, the five later penetrations manifest.

The *divine eye* perceives celestial events,
the *divine ear* hears heavenly speech,
*past-life recollection* reveals karmic causes,
*mind-reading* foretells future matters.
Only *spirit-realm penetration* reveals the spirit’s operations—
if one fails to uphold the Heart-Sovereign,
the spirit-mind will usurp control,
delighting in one’s ability to cultivate and verify,
while the *delight-magic* has already infiltrated the heart.
Thus, one speaks eagerly of worldly calamities and fortunes,
of future schemes—
and disaster follows swiftly.

Only when wisdom is applied without attachment,
and recognition transforms into true insight,
can the fruit of the perfected fetal body be attained.
As the ancients said:
*‘Without interruption for thirty thousand breaths,*
*every step and sit must be clearly aligned with the Dao.’*
This illuminates that the Ten-Month Nurturing of the Fetal Body
lies solely in the unbroken, still-luminous practice.’"*

*The Records of Daoist-Buddhist Fusion* says:

At this time, the *Zhāoyáng Jīng* states:
*"Tend to the infant carefully—whether ten steps, a hundred steps, a thousand, or ten thousand—gradually emerging. Should one be reckless, it will not endure wind and snow. Through long practice until maturity, one penetrates metal and pierces stone, walks on fire and treads water, reaches heaven and traverses earth, comes and goes without hindrance, hidden yet manifest. As one wills, so it is done—whether one or a hundred, a thousand million incarnations."*

The *Huángtíng Jīng* asks:
*"Gazing upon the child seated in stillness,
Who is this child within my own body?"*

The *Cāntóng Qì* commands:
*"Diligently practice without ceasing, day and night.
After three years of hidden nourishment, lightness and boundless movement follow.
Striding through fire, unscathed;
Entering water, unsoaked.
Presence and absence at will—
Endless joy, no sorrow."*

The *Tiānxiān Zhènglǐ* explains:
*"Adjusting the spirit to emerge from the shell as an external body,
From the Upper Field, the mind projects outward;
From the external body, the mind returns to the Upper Field.
With each ebb and flow, the emergence grows refined,
The nourishment deepens.
Thus, after three years of divine suckling,
The spirit becomes complete—
Capable of myriad transformations,
Ascending to heaven and descending to earth,
Crossing seas and moving mountains,
Alleviating drought and flood,
Saving the world and its people,
Destroying evil and banishing harm.
Whatever is wrought is the work of a single spirit.
Spirit transforms, spirit manifests—
This is the Dao of the Immortal."*

The *Tiānxiān Zhènglǐ* further declares:
*"When cultivation reaches the stage of spirit-emergence,
Death and birth are forever transcended.
Calamities and demons hold no sway.
At first, when the spirit emerges—
If it steps out once and returns,
Or twice and returns—
Whether ten steps or a hundred,
One must tend to it with care.
Only then may divine nourishment mature the spirit
Until full ripeness—
Three years hence."*

The *Tiānxiān Zhènglǐ* warns:
*"Adjusting the spirit to emerge from the shell is a critical juncture,
Fraught with great peril.
At first, let it emerge and swiftly return,
Not lingering long,
Nor perceiving distant realms.
With prolonged practice, the emergence may endure,
And distant sights and sounds may be glimpsed before return.
For if it rushes outward too swiftly,
It may lose its true nature."*

Master Zhāng Sānfēng’s *Jīndān Jiéyào* states:
*"Once the infant emerges,
Continuously adjust the spirit,
Endlessly emerging from the shell.
At first, return immediately—
Guard the vital form closely.
From near to far,
The spirit’s heat turns white.
In an instant, a thousand miles traverse.
The elixir furnace and vessel are abandoned—
What further use is there for technique?"*

*The *Chàngdào Zhēnyán* says:*

*"When the Yang-spirit sheds its form,
There is a radiance emanating from the navel wheel,
And a fragrance issuing from nose and mouth—
These are the omens of shedding the form.

After shedding, golden light radiates in all directions,
Hairs and pores glow crystal-clear,
Like the sun rising over the sea,
Or a pearl first glimpsed in the depths,
While the scent pervades the room.

A single thunderous crack—
Golden fire mingles, and the Yang-spirit
Already rests within the *níwán* [cinnabar field, 丹丸].

Once it has emerged,
All depends on one’s daily cultivation.
That is why I first spoke of refining the heart—
This is precisely its purpose.

If the heart is cultivated to be empty and luminous,
Then the Yang-spirit is pure *xiāntiān língqì* [preheaven essence-qi],
Originally devoid of thought or action,
Unstained by encounters, unmoved by sights,
Its retreat and extension under my command,
Its coming and going effortless as ever.
With its entry into the *níwán*,
The body feels as if aflame,
Golden light again streams from the pores,
And the fragrance fills the air once more.

In an instant,
It returns to the *Huángtíng* [Yellow Court],
As though nothing had happened—
Unknowing, unaware—
This is the true realm."*

*The *Chàngdào Zhēnyán* further states:*
*"The Yang-spirit, after shedding its form,
Returns to the Void—
Purple *qì* [vital energy] shimmering within light,
Something yet not a thing,
Form yet not a form,
Symbol-less yet the ultimate symbol,
Soundless yet the source of sound."*

*The *Chàngdào Zhēnyán* declares:*
*"The true Yang-spirit,
After piercing the crown,
Dwells in the *Tàixū* [Great Emptiness],
At ease, unbound—
In an instant, it soars ten thousand miles.

Above, it can caress the sun and moon,
Treading lightly on clouds and mists.
Below, it can roam the islands and seas,
Gazing upon scenic marvels."*

*"The Celestial Master Zhang Daoling, after refining his elixir, told his disciple Wang Chang: 'Taking the elixir should allow one to ascend to the heavens. *The *Xianchuan Shiyi* [Lost Records of Immortals] states: *"Though practitioners may hide in countless ways, they have not escaped the cycle of death. To the sick, I give medicine;
To the poor, I bestow gold and silver.

Scatter wealth to rescue the orphaned and indigent.
Some resolve injustices and punish the wronged,
Others alleviate difficulties and dispel chaos.
They admonish the unfilial and disobedient,
And guide the unrighteous and unvirtuous.
Wherever you go, propagate the great Dao,
Pointing out the path to those lost in delusion according to their karmic inclinations.
Widely bestow the *fǎrǔ* [law’s nourishment],
And guide beings to the Way,
To repay the Master’s virtue,
And to honor the恩 of one’s kin."*"

chunks.original_text: 上阳子日：“前胎完就，已成真人，则移上丹田，重整乾坤，再造阴阳，子又生孙，百千亿化。 《金丹四百字》曰：‘一载生个儿，个个会骑鹤。 ’泥丸祖曰：‘一载胎生一个儿，子生孙兮孙又枝，到此方是大丈夫也。 ’丹阳祖曰：‘神满太虚，亦无所碍，故天有时而崩，地有时而陷，山有时而摧，海有时而涸。 凡有象者，终归于坏。 惟有道者，永劫无坏。 又兼功及九祖，白日同升上清矣。 ’” 《椎阳经》曰：“再行功满，济世拔贫，眼炼神丹大药，形神俱妙，白昼飞升，全家拔宅，又在功德之浅深何如耳。 如或不服神丹，只是阳神冲举，回视旧骸，一堆粪土。 倘能修服大丹，刀圭入口，白日羽翰，宇宙同泰矣。 ” 龙眉子曰：“九年面壁之后，灵台莹彻，觉海圆明，形神俱妙，与道合真。 彼时性命混融，太虚同体。 功积三千，行累八百，游戏人间，潜伏俟时。 天书诏拜，飞身金阙，返佩帝乡，世间富贵，何可比之？ 此乃大丈夫功成名遂之时也。 ” 《参同契》曰：“道成德就，潜伏俟时。 太乙乃召，移居中洲。 功满上升，膺箓受图。 ”

The **Shàng Yáng Zi** said:
*"When the prenatal essence is fully refined,
And one has already become a True Person,
Then one ascends to the Upper Elixir Field,
Realigns Heaven and Earth,
Renews Yin and Yang,
And gives birth to son and grandson—
A myriad, countless transformations."*

The *Jīn Dān Sìbǎi Zì* states:
*"In one year, a child is born,
Each child able to ride a crane."*

The **Ní Wán Zǔ** declared:
*"In one year, a child is born from the prenatal essence—
Son begets grandson, and grandson branches forth,
Only then is one a true Great Man."*

The **Dān Yáng Zǔ** proclaimed:
*"The spirit fills the boundless void,
Yet meets no obstruction—
Thus, heaven sometimes collapses,
Earth sometimes sinks,
Mountains sometimes crumble,
Seas sometimes dry up.
All formed things eventually decay,
But the Daoist alone remains unshaken through countless eons.
With accumulated virtue, one ascends to the Upper Pure in broad daylight."*

The *Zhuī Yáng Jīng* says:
*"When the second stage of cultivation is complete,
One rescues the world and uplifts the poor.
Refining the eyes to forge the spirit elixir—
The great medicine of perfection—
Form and spirit both attain marvelous purity,
Ascending in daylight,
Whole households lifted to celestial halls.
Yet this depends on the depth of one’s virtue.
If one does not take the spirit elixir,
Only the yang spirit surges upward,
Gazing back at the old corpse—
A heap of dung.
But if one cultivates the great elixir,
The golden pill enters the mouth,
And in daylight, one takes flight—
The universe then shares in its harmony."*

The **Lóng Méi Zi** spoke:
*"After nine years of facing the wall,
The luminous platform is clear,
The sea of awakening is bright,
Form and spirit both attain marvelous purity,
And merge with the True Dao.
Then, nature and life blend as one,
The boundless void becomes the self.
With virtue accumulated to three thousand,
And deeds meriting eight hundred,
One plays among mortals,
Lying dormant, awaiting the moment.
When the Heavenly Scriptures summon,
The body flies to the Golden Gate,
Returning to the Celestial Court—
What worldly wealth can compare?
This is the time when a Great Man fulfills his destiny and achieves renown."*

The *Cāntóng Qì* states:
*"When the Dao is perfected and virtue attained,
One lies dormant, awaiting the moment.
The Great Unity then summons,
And one relocates to the Central Continent.
With virtue complete, one ascends,
Receiving the talismans and scriptures.
The elixir’s efficacy is manifest."*

chunks.original_text: 《唱道真言》曰：“游六合以外之名山，观八方不及之风气。 鼓瑟于琪林瑶圃，艺药于琼馆芝田。 分司造化，佐天帝于真空妙有之境，握枢机于太无太极之宫。 各事其事而不劳，各行所行而不乱。 天地之大，如指诸掌，近在目前，何乐如之？ ” 《唱道真言》曰：“道妙自然，真境逍遥，永无贪着。 ” 《唱道真言》曰：“淘得一点元神，如水月交辉。 尽天地，遍乾坤，都比作一团紫彩金光，上贯三清，下彻六道。 将见元始天尊，与毗卢遮那古佛，欢然来会，与之握手，叙契阔之多时，恨相见之已晚。 ” 张三丰《金丹节要》曰：“欲证天仙，须宜面壁。 可选名山福地，古迹灵坛，水拱山朝，聚气藏风之处，傍云构室，背阴向阳，后龙如宝镜之高悬，前案似神锋之插立。 有此胜境，无他崩洪，可以结圜。 始为面壁，兀然静坐养神，仿要虚心守一，如龙养颌下之珠，似鸟抱巢中之卵。 形神俱妙，与道合真，入水火不溺、不焚，步日月无形、无影。 ”曹文逸仙始曰：“九年功满火候足，应物无心神化速。 ” 邵子《安乐窝诗》：“直从泰岸收功后，始信人间大丈夫。 ” 张紫阳《悟真篇序》曰：“到此名题仙籍，位号真人，乃大丈夫功成名遂之时也。 ” 《仙佛合宗语录》曰：“神不自神，复归无极，体证虚无，只以完其恒性于焉。 心与俱化，法与俱忘。 寂之无所寂也，照之无所照也。 佛云：‘欲证虚空体，示等虚空法。 证得虚空时，无是无非法。 ’” 《唱道真言》：“此时形神俱妙，紫光玄炁，充满于天高地厚之间。 明则为日月，锐则为雷霆，鼓荡则为风，润泽则为雨。 寻声救苦，无感不通。 握大造之枢机，为众生之父母。 ” 《洞玄真经》曰：“入金石而不阻不碍，入水火而不溺不焚。 隐则步青山而无形无影，显则充法界而亿万化身。 散则成炁，聚则成形。 形神俱妙，与道合真。 天地之间，一个完人。 “功完行满，玉敕宾迎。 骖鸾跨鹤，朝觐天庭。 九玄七祖，尽得超生，这回才是真仙子，这回才是大功名。 任他劫运，我独长存。 “真光法界，任意逍遥，大而化之，不可得而知矣。 显大法相，放大毫光，百千万亿身，遍满虚空界。 ”

*"The *Chàngdào Zhēnyán* states:
'To wander beyond the Six Unities in famed mountains,
And observe the winds and *qi* of the eight directions, unmatched.
To pluck the *qin* in the groves of *qí* trees and jade plants,
And cultivate medicines in the halls of jade and fields of *zhī* herbs.
To assist the Celestial Sovereign in the realm of True Dao’s marvelous manifestation,
And hold the pivotal mechanisms in the palace of the Boundless and Supreme Ultimate.
Each attending to their duties without toil,
Each acting in their appointed ways without disorder.
The vastness of Heaven and Earth,
Like fingers upon the palm—near at hand,
What joy could surpass this?'

*The *Chàngdào Zhēnyán* further declares:
'The Dao’s marvel is natural,
The true realm is free and unbound,
Forever free from greed and attachment.'

*The *Chàngdào Zhēnyán* continues:
'Refining a single spark of original spirit,
Like moonlight rippling on water.
Spanning Heaven and Earth,
Permeating the *qiánkūn* [cosmic framework],
All compared to a cluster of violet radiance and golden light—
Ascending to the Three Pure Ones,
Descending through the Six Paths.
One will soon behold the Primordial Celestial Venerable,
And the Ancient Buddha *Pílú Zhēnà*,
Joyfully meeting them,
Shaking hands in fellowship,
After long separation,
Lamenting the delay of this reunion.'

Zhang Sanfeng in *The Essentials of Golden Elixir* says:
'To attain the Heavenly Immortal,
One must face the wall in seclusion.
Choose renowned mountains and blessed lands,
Ancient sites and sacred altars,
Where *qi* gathers and winds are stored,
Build a dwelling beside the clouds,
Backed by shade, facing the sun,
With a dragon’s head suspended like a gem-mirror before you,
And a sacred incense burner standing like a divine blade behind.
With such a supreme setting,
No calamity nor flood can disrupt—
The foundation is secure.
At first, one faces the wall,
Sitting motionless to nurture the spirit,
Emulating the emptied mind guarding the One,
Like a dragon nurturing the pearl beneath its chin,
Or a bird cradling its egg in the nest.
When form and spirit both attain marvelous purity,
And merge with the True Dao,
One enters water and fire without drowning or burning,
And walks with the sun and moon without trace or shadow.'

Cao Wenyixian initially said:
'Nine years of fulfilled labor, the fire’s readiness complete,
Responding to all things without thought—spirit transforms swiftly.'

Shaozi in *Poems of Tranquil Joy* states:
'Only after returning to the banks of the Great,
Do I truly believe a Great Man has been born.'

Zhang Ziyang in the *Preface to the Treatise on Awakening to the True* says:
'To reach this honored title in the Immortal Registers,
And the designation of True Person—
This is the time when a Great Man fulfills his destiny and achieves renown.'

*The *Records of the Unified Dao of Immortals and Buddhas* declare:
'The spirit does not manifest itself;
It returns to the Boundless Ultimate.
The body attains the Void—
Only thus does one perfect their enduring nature.
Heart and *dharma* transform together,
Law is forgotten as one.
Stillness without object,
Illumination without focus.
The Buddha said:
*"To verify the body of the Void,
One must demonstrate the law of the Void.
When the Void is realized,
There is neither ‘this’ nor ‘that’ law."*
The *Chàngdào Zhēnyán* proclaims:
'At this moment, form and spirit both attain marvelous purity,
Violet light and mysterious *qi* fill the heavens and earth.
When manifest, it becomes the sun and moon;
When sharp, it becomes thunder and lightning;
When stirring, it becomes wind;
When nourishing, it becomes rain.
Seeking voices to relieve suffering—
Without sensation, all is communicated.
Holding the pivotal mechanisms of Great Transformation,
One becomes parent to all beings.'

*The *Authentic Scripture of the Cavern of the Mystic Dao* states:
'Entering metal and stone without hindrance or obstruction,
Entering water and fire without drowning or burning.
In concealment, one walks the green mountains without trace or shadow;
In revelation, one fills the *dharma*-realm with myriad forms.
Dispersed, one becomes *qi*;
Gathered, one becomes form.
When form and spirit both attain marvelous purity,
And merge with the True Dao—
A perfect being between Heaven and Earth.
With virtue complete and deeds fulfilled,
Imperial decrees welcome one as guest.
Riding the *zhuànluán* [heavenly dragon] and straddling the crane,
One pays homage to the Celestial Court.
The Nine Mystic and Seven Ancestral lineages,
All attain transcendence—
This time, truly an Immortal,
This time, great renown achieved.
Let the ages pass,
I alone endure forever.

The True Light of the *Dharma*-realm,
Roams freely at will,
Expanding and transforming—
None can fathom its essence.
Revealing the great *dharma* form,
Emitting boundless radiance—
Hundreds, thousands, tens of millions of forms,
Fill the Void-realm entirely.'"
